introduction.title: The Crow Queen
introduction.tagline: All land bends. All flesh kneels.
introduction.description: Once the absolute ruler of Monstru, the Crow Queen—now called the Regent Black—was deposed by a monster uprising so vulgar it still offends her sense of order. Stripped of her throne but not her divinity of will, she fled with her Inner Court into exile, bearing crowns without kingdoms and laws without land. In Coffin Canyon, she has found not refuge, but provocation. Here, she consecrates dust into demesne, collars monsters into obedience, and grinds manlings beneath the heel of remembered sovereignty. The Canyon does not yet know it kneels—but it will.
introduction.philosophy: Order is not debated. It is declared. Hierarchy is not cruel—it is natural, and the Regent Black stands at its apex by undeniable right. Monsters are instruments, humans are livestock, and land exists only to be named, measured, and ruled. The Crow Queen does not conquer for wealth, survival, or necessity. She conquers because a crown unused is an insult to creation itself.
introduction.history: The fall of Monstru shattered the Crow Court, but it did not erase it. Loyal servants followed their Queen into exile, carrying relics of authority, ledgers of blood-debt, and rites that bind stone and soil to command. Coffin Canyon is not a hiding place—it is a proving ground. Every skirmish is a ceremony. Every claimed hill is a remembered law. The Queen does not rebuild her empire hastily; she restores it correctly.

core_values: Humans exist to be punished or die
what_they_fight_for: Exaltation of land into royal demesne
Restoration of the Crow Queen’s sovereignty
what_they_fight_against: Any rival claim to land or authority

reputation.allies_see_them_as: Cruel but inevitable rulers whose dominion brings terrible, orderly stability
reputation.monsters_see_them_as: Masters—feared, obeyed, resented, and never forgiven
reputation.the_canyon_sees_them_as: A crown returning, one consecrated stone at a time

faction_mechanics.signature_ability_description: The Crow Queen faction reshapes the battlefield through Consecrated Ground generated by the Regent Black and Demesne Markers. This ground suppresses morale failure, reinforces obedience, and accelerates faction momentum, turning terrain itself into an instrument of rule.
faction_mechanics.playstyle: Slow, oppressive territorial control. The Crow Queen begins constrained and ceremonial, then snowballs as Consecrated Ground spreads. They excel at morale pressure, objective denial, ritual dominance, and late-game inevitability.
weaknesses: Punished heavily if the Regent Black falls

preferred_states.reason: The Regent Black’s ideal outcome—land fully bound, named, and ruled

neutral_states.reason: A tolerated interregnum while full Exaltation is prepared

opposed_states.reason: An insult to hierarchy and rightful dominion
Uncontrolled monster autonomy threatens royal authority

faction_features.name: Demesne Markers
faction_features.effect: Demesne Markers create Consecrated Ground in a 12" radius. Effects are identical to the Regent Black’s Sovereign Presence.

faction_features.name: The Realm Answers
faction_features.effect: Enemy units within Consecrated Ground cannot ignore Shaken for any reason.

units.name: The Regent Black
units.lore: The Crow Queen herself—calm, immaculately composed, and utterly certain of her right to rule. She does not rage. She corrects. Bowing is not requested; it is assumed.
units.tactics: Anchor the battlefield and protect at all costs. Her presence defines the fight, and her fall is catastrophic both mechanically and narratively.

units.name: Ladies in Waiting

optional_upgrades.name: Sweet Cakes
optional_upgrades.effect: Once per game: Remove Shaken from an allied unit within 6"

units.lore: Silent attendants who carry banners, obelisks, ritual comforts, and poison-laced sweets. They do not fight for glory; they fight to ensure the Queen is never inconvenienced.
units.tactics: Deploy early to establish Demesne Markers and stabilize morale. Keep them behind the main line; their value is ceremonial and positional, not martial.

units.name: High Huntsman
units.lore: Master of the Queen’s hunts—manling or monster, it matters not. He selects targets with aristocratic disdain, loosing arrows as sentences rather than shots.
units.tactics: Apply pressure to priority targets and force enemy movement. Use range upgrades to dominate firing lanes and punish exposed leaders.

units.name: The Jester
units.lore: A laughing Klowna horror bound by oath and hunger. The Queen finds him endlessly amusing; the rest of the Court endure him in silence, lest they become part of the joke.
units.tactics: Disrupt enemy formations and morale. Push him aggressively into contested zones where his presence causes maximum psychological damage.

units.name: Major Domo
units.lore: Banker, advisor, and keeper of the Queen’s ledgers. Every life, every stone, every favor is recorded—nothing is forgiven, nothing is forgotten.
units.tactics: Support territorial play by maintaining Demesne presence. Keep him protected and cycling resources to sustain long engagements.

units.name: Crown’s Champion
units.lore: The Queen’s shield and High Champion, clad in ritual armor that has never known retreat. He does not advance—he is placed.
units.tactics: Interpose between threats and the Regent Black. Hold chokepoints and deny enemy breakthroughs with sheer durability.

units.name: My Pet
units.lore: A collared creature that scurries ahead to claim what the Queen desires. Whether it understands loyalty or merely pain is irrelevant.
units.tactics: Rush objectives and harass weak points. Expect it to die eventually—its purpose is speed, not survival.

units.name: Dark Skald
units.lore: A many-fingered skald whose black lyre hums with ancient law. Each note is not music but remembrance—commands the land itself once obeyed and longs to obey again.
units.tactics: Morale control and consecration amplifier. Protect him and let the battlefield sing.
